ml.recommendation

Class STSR

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.recommendation.STSR

  • public class STSR
extends java.lang.Object
    A Java implementation of structured sparse (polynomial) regression (STSR) by ALS.
    Version:
    1.0 Mar. 20th, 2015
    Author:
    Mingjie Qian

        private static java.lang.String AppDirPath

        Feature size.

      • n

        private static int n
        Data size.

      • b

        private static double b
        Bias.

      • w

        private static double[] w
        First order weights. w[j] is the linear weight for feature j.

      • W

        private static double[][] W
        Second order weights. W[i][j] is the weight for feature i and j.

      • y

        private static int[] y
        Labels.

      • y_hat

        private static double[] y_hat
        y_hat[i] is the predicted value for instance i.

      • e

        private static double[] e
        e[i] = y[i] - y_hat[i].

      • X

        private static Matrix X
        n x d data matrix.

      • lambda

        private static double lambda
        Let the data matrix X be an n x p matrix, then XColumns[j] = X[:,j].

      • nu

        private static double nu

      • L

        private static double[][] L
        Lipschitz constant for W[i][j]

        HashMap, ArrayList>> map.
        i j r X[r][i] * X[r][j]

      • allocateResource

        public static void allocateResource()
        Just need call this method once to allocate required resources. Feature sizes will be set. This method should be called after training data is loaded.

      • feedTrainingData

        public static void feedTrainingData(DataSet dataSet)

      • feedTrainingData

        public static void feedTrainingData(java.lang.String trainFilePath)
        Read a data set from a LIBSVM formatted file. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features. Note that the default starting index is 0.
        Parameters:
        trainFilePath - file path for the training data

      • feedTrainingData

        public static void feedTrainingData(java.lang.String trainFilePath,
                    int idxStart)
        Read a data set from a LIBSVM formatted file. Note that an empty string will be viewed as an empty sparse feature vector. Empty sparse vectors commonly occur when a test example only has new features.
        Parameters:
        trainFilePath - file path for the training data
        idxStart - starting index

      • loadData
